revised_title: Observations on Mist Formation and Temperature in Water and Air
tldr: The author investigates the formation of mists over rivers and lakes at night, explaining that it occurs when the air above the land is colder than the air above the water. This phenomenon is due to the different ways land and water lose heat, with water cooling the surrounding air as it evaporates. The author provides numerous examples of observations made during his travels, showing how the temperature of the water and air affects mist formation.
